subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Kristin
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-765265704-1196293605=:51171
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Some people think it matters. I dont. I record at various times of day/night. However when you are attempting to make a connection it does help if you do your part to put the effort in on a regular basis. My messages and contacts have grown over time. But the ability is there at any given moment.
   
  I know many people have difficulty getting started and they found it helped when they set aside part of the day to do thier sessions. For some it took months, for others they had luck the first time they record. As for me mine happened quite by chance the first time and they have just been there ever since. Some days the messages are clear, others not so great. I also never record if I am too tired, angry, or sick. It just doesnt help the positive flow of energy to come thru. 
   
  Just try a few things and find the way that works best for you and your circumstances.
   
  Misty

Kristin Morris <ckmorris95@...> wrote:
              Thanks Misty.  I appreciate you and the others keeping an ear for their names.  Does experimenting at the same time everyday make any difference to help make connections?
  k
  
      
---------------------------------
  
  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Misty Dawn
Sent: Wednesday, November 28, 2007 4:15 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: New file uploaded to EVP-ITC

  
          I wish you luck Kristin. It helps to work with others sometimes others will get messages to pass on. If your sis is willing perhaps she could record with you too sometimes. Theres a variety of methods you can do there at home. With crossing sometimes theres a time barrier on this side, for us it seems to be either right away when they connect or long after. I am not sure why that is. I only know that for them time has no meaning. Often they say things months or years ahead of "time" or I just dont get it until much later down the road. 

    

    They are welcome to speak in my sessions if they wish to and I am sure others here feel the same. So they will have many moments in "time" to choose from to come thru. If I hear those names I'll be sure and forward it on. Many names pass thru here. I dont know them but I try to post some of them just in case its for others. Im unable to post all of my files because I have very little free time. 

    

    Let me just say that as a mom with kids, you only need a good half hour to record a couple minutes (set limits...no more than 3 minutes, but 30 seconds will do fine usually) then spend the rest of the half hour analyzing your files. Try to record often and that helps you strengthen the connection on your end as well as thiers. Once the connection is made, you may find that others give you answers to questions you have about them even if they are not ready to speak to us themselves. So maybe once the kids are in bed, and all is quiet in the house, you will find 30 minutes to research. If one method isnt working for you try one of the others you may get better results to get you started down the path.

    

    Misty

Kristin Morris <ckmorris95@...> wrote:

            Misty � this gives me hope.  I am so new to this and not technical in the least.  I wish I had 24 hours a day to dedicate to ITC but I have small children and they seem to take all my time.  I am hoping to find a few hours to modify that RS and really begin my attempts.  I am very grateful that this low tech idea was passed onto to us!  Just 3 weeks ago I too lost my niece (17yrs) and nephew (14yrs) to a car accident.  Aly, my niece died on impact, but her brother Ryan hung on for 4 more days and I was there with my sister (his mom) and his dad when they ended life support.  I don�t know if it is too soon.. but what a wonderful gift I could give my sister if I could capture their voices and let her know that her two children are still with us.

    k

      
---------------------------------
  
    From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Misty Dawn
Sent: Wednesday, November 28, 2007 1:36 AM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: New file uploaded to EVP-ITC


            Glad she made it thru but sorry it had to be this way. I understand how that feels. Yes on the training part too, I have gotten that quite often over the years when new spirits begin to speak sometimes the others help them or even speak for them if they arent getting across clearly. Sometimes its very detailed instructions that blow my mind. But it is interesting to listen to thier conversations there. 


      I also used to notice that sometimes when I would try a new method it would be almost as if my close contacts would go to another broadcasting station, go in, introduce themselves and announce they were there to speak to me or the relation to me then take over the session. Sometimes I think different methods invite new contacts/entities. However many of the contacts remain the same and will use any method I choose. 


      Losing so many people on this side only strengthens the bonds to that side more. Of that I have no doubt. It's the ties that bind. Very true statement. For those who havent experienced loss its a bit of a different experience overall. Theres nothing that can compare to hearing a voice thats been dead for so long or that you thought you would never hear again in this lifetime. Some of you know how that feels. It just hits such a high note that it resonates thru your spirit sometimes. In my case I have too many best friends, loved ones, relations who went before me and did keep thier promise to stay in touch whatever it took. 


      Only when we were all making those promises so many years ago we were just saying it more for the joke of it rather than the reality of it. One by one they all crossed over, and one by one they have kept thier promises. 


      So, that being said


      "If I die before you die I'm coming back to haunt you all"


      


      Misty


      
Steve Hultay <urkel23@...> wrote:


          Yeah, since i start using the Radio Shack radios i have been getting 
full sentence conversations with them. I've been trying to contact 
my ex-girlfriend that passed last year at 29. That does sound like 
her voice, she has been coming through since Sunday night and i 
actually heard them through the radio telling her to talk and she 
said "Hi Steve". They were like training her to use the radio, 
pretty weird stuff but it was good to hear from her in her own 
voice. The response time is remarkable with these radios, they seem 
to answer right away very "frank's box"-like. These will keep me 
occupied while i wait for #27---the #13 replacement. I'm really 
excited about that one, it may be the one to live up to for all 
future boxes. I'm sure Frank could buy a radio shack box and add a 
sound chamber, that would probably really enhance the voices. These 
other boxes and radios are great, but there's only one Frank's Box 
for all others to try to live up to. I don't think a 10 Minute mod 
on a $25 dollar radio will ever replace the time and effort frank 
puts into his boxes. But anybody can try these radios and that's 
what is important, but without Frank there would have been no 
advancement in ITC. Someone had to break the ground work.

-Steve H.

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@...> wrote:
>
> Steve this one is shockingly responsive. Is the voice 
recognizable? -Bill
